section.title: Document Conventions
section.para: Terms defined to have a specific meaning within this specification will be capitalized, for example, “Normalized Graph”, and should be interpreted with their general meaning if not capitalized. Normative key words are written in all caps, for example, “SHALL”.

XDI notations use the XDI Single Line Display format as defined in . In some cases, other serializations may be used, in which case, the serialization form used will be indicated. Multiple statements will appear as follows: ([=]!1111)/$ref/ =example<#name>&/&/"Example Subject" =example<#email>&/&/"subject@example.org" =example/#friend/=alice =example/#friend/=bob /$is$ref/([=]!1111) Inidividual statements may be used inline, in which case they will appear in fixed width Serif: =example<#name>&/&/"Example Subject".
